title: Gaming
body:
Legalizing sports gaming in MA is not a slam dunk, a low slow curve, or just an extra point. No surprise, where are the casino’s? After all, who in vote rich suburbia really wants their child to graduate and become a dealer? Hell, they don’t even want it for someone else’s kid.  



However, there is some room for the pro gaming forces as the Democrats seem unsure if its good, revenue, or bad, regressive. As for fantasy on line sports gaming 27% are already there, mostly Millennials, but they may not be big enough to get it on anyone’s agenda, until the recession.  



#### IN A GENERAL IN OCTOBER 18  

The Supreme Court in May overturned a law prohibiting states from legalizing sports gambling. How strongly would you support Massachusetts legalizing sports gambling? 10/18 MPG state general  


|            |     |     |     |     |     | 
|------------|-----:|-----:|-----:|-----:|-----:| 
|            |All Voters|| R's | D's | I's |
| Very       | 31% |     | 42% | 30% | 29% | 
| Somewhat   | 20% | 51% | 18% | 15% | 23% | 
| Not Very   | 26% | 49% | 16% | 29% | 27% | 
| Not at all | 23% |     | 23% | 25% | 22% |

Would you support or oppose legalizing sports gambling in Massachusetts?  4/19 Emerson state D-primary
